channel.title: Quicktip on NS News and Views
channel.description: Recent content in Quicktip on NS News and Views

item.title: Power Automate to populate a blood pressure spreadsheet - using an email subject field!
item.description: OK….that title was a bit of a mouthful - but it’s a little difficult to categorise what is essentially a kind of hack! Recently, I felt it was advisable to start regularly recording my blood pressure results (comes with age I’m afraid).

item.title: How to populate an O365 DG from a Security Group
item.description: Having fully migrated our on-prem Exchange to Exchange Online, there were a few little gotchas along the way that we had to contend with - which was to be expected.

item.title: How to delete an email from all Exchange mailboxes
item.description: It’s not uncommon to receive unwanted emails which have managed to work their way through the array of filtering systems in production. Recently our organisation received such an email - a classic phishing email sent to multiple end user accounts.

item.title: YouTube downloading using WSL
item.description: To be honest, as I’m sure any right-minded individual would agree, downloading videos from YouTube for personal gain is wrong. However, there are occasions when it is arguably reasonable and possibly even legitimate to do such a thing.

item.title: Encourage those Windows to restart!
item.description: A common issue with supporting a primarily Windows based user body, is that thanks to the “always on” expectation emboldened by smartphones and tablets, it can be a constant battle to try and encourage end users to restart their computers with some degree of regularity - yes IT friends, you know exactly what I mean!

item.title: How to get the latest student photo from iSAMS
item.description: It’s been eight months since my last blog post, having taken on a new job, been on the receiving end of a full-on enterprise ransomware attack (that wasn’t nice!) and quite frankly experiencing one heck of a baptism of fire - I felt it was time do write a quick blog post tip!

item.title: Honeypots to catch prying eyes!
item.description: As I have mentioned in previous blog posts, I regularly listen to numerous technical podcasts. A relatively new edition to my listening collection is the information security podcast Risky Business – it’s great!

item.title: PowerShell to disable Clutter in Office 365
item.description: Most users of Office 365 will no doubt be aware of the Clutter folder; for the most part this Clutter folder works pretty well. I’m not intending to go into the algorithmic processes of how the Clutter folder works, in this blog post - even if I could!

item.title: Office 365, Outlook & attachments
item.description: Recently, we received rather confusing claims from specific users, stating they were receiving certain emails, often days after they had been sent. This behavior was not consistent across the user base.

item.title: Excel Macro to manipulate CAT data
item.description: Recently, I was asked whether I could provide some assistance with manipulating data, that had been exported from a CAT results test. The problem, had slowly been driving a colleague of mine, very slightly crazy!

item.title: Locked out user email notification
item.description: It recently occurred to me, that whilst my current full-time position is an IT Systems Manager, the majority of my blog posts thus far, have been more web centric – which is great, as I love the web and web technologies!
